etymons.meaning: to be; to become, result, be made

translations: the years 40-41 famine broke out in these

Preterit\nIntransitive.turoyo: 1) ko-ḥozeno u=qawroʕatim-awohawiodayeʕelaytoLB 148;u=ʕulmo i=naqqadə-ḥzele i=ʕuǧube d-i=ruḥoqadišo, mhaymanne, w-hawənMšəḥoye 12/5; aḏnikayiwo, hawinokarr, hawinohulyarḥokarrjl 18.7.11;

2) mən-yohawxa? mənhawi? l-aykogəd-mublitu as=səfoq-ani? 620; 2/74; 36/79; hawiṣafro’; 21/64; abrə-d-u=malko d-kit-we msiko d-šaməʕ i=masale d-hawyo u=taʕlo d-mílle-le-yo ‘’; 21/64 məd-hawiṣafro u=malkoaṯi l-i=baxča d-oxəl u=ḥawušo 21/5; hawibaynoṯayyeḥsomobəġḏ̣a’; 22/2
translations: der König in den Garten, um den Apfel

Preterit\nIntransitive.turoyo: 5) hawi-le abro, w mḏ̣ayəʕ 621; prs 53/20; hawino b-i=šato d-ann=alfočaʕmotloṯ w-tleṯi b-Məḏyaḏḏḏʼ4/2; k-ubʕenodə-mzabnat-li u=abr-anodiḏux d-hawi ‘I’; 23/13 [MT]
7) d-hat d-lə=mamṭat-li u=zlām-ano ono l-áwyal-lox barṯow hat l-awət-li babo 625; 66/209;

ko-Preterit.turoyo: uʕdo (…) k-awiʕišči b-Almānyako-ġoyaṭ-la bəṯṯərbayn u=dahwo ko-ḥoyər ko-mofaq-la ga kal k-awyodahwo
translations: ‘Now (…) he has become a working man in Germany’ EL 19;
‘After that he dipped it (his finger, f.) into gold. He took it out and looked: it has become gold’ 75/130;
‘We would shake (the milk) approximately for an hour, then we would look into the skin: something similar to pearls has appeared (there)’

Preterit-wa.turoyo: 1) hawo d-aqdam d-aṯi-wo l-u=ṭlobayḏax u=gawrayḏi-wahwé-way-le tamokanošo b-i=dərtaṯxu 619; 62/350; hawi-wo kmo=banniyat w dukkaneḥaṯe 621; 11/8; hēš l-awyo-wačāx d-i=ḥšəmto116/2;
arʕo ono k-oḏaʕn-a qorə́n-way-lamaḥat-wa-lleəšme d-i=arʕo d-i=qarnoəmmiwa i=arʕo d-i=qarnohaṯemən=hawi-waeba
translations: ‘One piece of land that I know – people had named it the

Infectum.turoyo: 1) ono dayəmmaširóno-no ʕal u=ʕamo d-hōn(<howən)mšayne w rəḥmiḥḏoḏe w maraḥqiruḥayye m-aḥ=ḥəṭyawoṯo LB 105; hat lazəm d-fayšətharke b-i=mamlaxṯo, w-bəṯṯər mini gd-owətmalko ‘’; ; ánnaqqagəd-uwyal-lox tamāmaṯto
2) ono obáʕ-way-no howe-li fərsa…hăma d-məǧġənno b-i=masale d-i=diyane; LB 107; lə=k-oḏəʕfaqiromə kt-owe ebe 622; 77/107; hat, u=mede d-ubʕət, hawxagd-owe ‘’; 24/78
Mḥammadbări me d-howe, (…) b-karse d-i=emo, alohokṯule i=šahad-aṯe (…) ʕaləšme
translations: ‘Muhammad, before he was born, (while he was) in his mother’s womb, God had written this testimony (…) about his name’

Infectum.turoyo: 6) u=gawro k-owe u=gawro d-i=ḥurma 625; 83/30; 8) mwaʕadleʕalruḥehul d-lo=ḥoze u=šayro lo=k-owe d-doʕər 24/147;+ Leb Beg s.66/100; 5) i=naqqa d-k-owa-lle l-ap=pirat, b-a=tmanyo=yawme ko-məblən-ne l-i=ʕito 626; 94/48; 6) omár-way-no năfarṭawwo-hət w kt-owət gabi jl 19.6.18; [MLT];
mədli l-u=fir-ayḏi w-šəfq-ayḏi, məṛṛe: “lo=k-owe d-maydət-te, g-məblina-nne l-i=maḥkăma”hat g-maḥtəttloṯo=mo=dinare, hul d-lo=maḥtət-te, lo=k-owe d-nəfqətadyawma lo=k-owe illa g-əzzinoqm-aʕ=ʕeze
translations: ‘I picked up my skullcap and my hat, but they said: “You may not take them, we will take them to the court” LB 330;
‘You must pay three hundred dinars. Until you pay (that sum), you cannot go out’ EL 51;
‘Today I am certainly going with the goats!’ 75/52;

Infectum-wa.turoyo: 1) d-l-ówe-wo qarʕi b-u=kuxo, kət-wo be d-nak-wo-li? 627; prs 29/23; xuzi am=maye d-lo=k-rŭḏ̣etubənnehŭwan-wo b-Mərde [MT] 20/9; tamokət-yoṭayro; marfan-wo u=ḥa d-uṯe-wo u=ṭayr-awo d-kule-wo ʕalriše, huwehuwe-wo ḥakəm d-i=walay-ayo ‘; 24/310 [MT]; hat d-ŭwat-wo b-dukṯə-d-u=taǧər-ano, gəd-ŭbat-wo dasṭūr d-i=kačk-ayo
translations: du an der Stelle des Kaufmanns

Infectum-wa.turoyo: 5) kət-wo-le tloṯ=niše, l-owé-wo-le abnemənayye 627; prs 240/1; 6) babi u=maḥṣulayḏe howe-wa u=qəršqərš; mḥayṣal-wo kallatġắlabe 627; 63/28; 8) ʕal u=sozayḏe d-hule soz qawyo l-ówe-wa d-omər 627; 64/306;

Imperativ.turoyo: 1) hwaygawro w itoxhzam-li 628; prs 20/36; prs 68/5; 57/109; 61/315; 70/82, 86; hwawuamīn, u=yawmo d-əzzoxu l-Məḏyaḏ, ʕalak=katfoṯo, gəm-məṭʕonutu! ḏḏ 11/326;

Infinitiv.turoyo: hwoyo; 628; 5) b-u=mahwo d-hawi u=abro, kət-wafaršeʕalfema d-i=ʕayno, qum i=škaftaṯṯe 628; 69/234;
